thread.title: What you need to know about Apple's new devices
thread.title_full: What you need to know about Apple's new devices

author:
Patrick May

pmay@mercurynews.com
title: What you need to know about Apple's new devices
text:
Posted: 09/09/2015 04:05:51 PM PDT Updated: 09/09/2015 04:09:43 PM PDT Here are some of the products and updates announced by Apple on Wednesday: iPhone 6s and 6s Plus Prices start at: $199 and $299 (with two-year contract) 
Available : Preorder on Sept. 12, in stores around the globe Sept. 25 
What's new: Most advanced iPhone ever, includes enhanced Multi-Touch interface with 3D Touch, letting users apply more or less pressure on the screen to call up different information in mail, websites and various apps; strongest glass ever for a smartphone; improved photo features, including Live Photos which bring still images to life by capturing a moment in motion. iPad Pro Apple CEO Tim Cook discusses the new iPad during the Apple event at the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium in San Francisco, Wednesday, Sept. 9, 2015. (Eric Risberg/AP photo) Prices start at: $799 
Available: November 
What's new: 12.9-inch Retina® display with 5.6 million pixels, the most ever in an iOS device; better performance with new 64-bit A9X chip, rivaling most portable PCs; thin and light and provides all-day battery life. Apple Pencil Price: $99 
Available: November 
What's new: Enhanced accuracy for fine art illustration and detailed 3D design; sensors pressure and tilt for a fast and fluid drawing experience; works with popular apps like Mail and Notes. Apple Watch Prices start at: $349 
Available: Today 
What's new: New Apple Watch® cases and bands, including new gold and rose gold aluminum; watchOS„¢ 2 arrives as a free update on Sept. 16 and further enhances performance with new features and native third-party apps. Apple TV Prices start at: $149 
Available: End of October 
What's new: Rebuilt with new generation of high-performance hardware; new intuitive user interface on the remote with both Siri and a touch screen; move through shows and movies and call up detailed information about content; shop, watch sports, play games and plan vacations on the TV screen; buy apps through the new Apple TV App Store. Contact Patrick May at 408-920-5689 or follow him at Twitter.com/patmaymerc
